column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////I've lived in Chicago for 9 years
column2: and I have a secret: I hate deep dish pizza. I think it's kinda gross. I had only tried Giordanos
column3: and discovered that pizza that needs to be eaten with a fork and consists of a wall of pure cheese simply does not appeal to me at all. I tried Lou Malnatis recently in order to give deep dish pizza another chance to impress me
column4: and it did not disappoint! The crust is crispy and buttery
column5: and you can actually pick this pizza up! The cheese wasn't overpowering the meal
column6: and whatever sauce they're using over there is to die for. I work in tourism and I will definitely be sending customers looking for deep dish towards this place from now on. It was delicious. Well done.
